name: Mount Resolution

trails_config.name: Davis Path via Mt. Parker Trail
trails_config.description: A less-traveled hike that rewards with sublime solitude and views. Starting from Crawford Notch, follow the Davis Path and then branch onto the Mount Parker Trail toward Mount Resolution. The trek is long with moderate grades until some steep ledgy bits near Resolution’s summit. The broad, flat ledges on top provide sweeping views—on one side into the wild Dry River valley and on the other toward Stairs Mountain and the Presidential ridge. This is a hidden gem for experienced hikers seeking tranquility away from the crowds.
trails_config.parking_info: Mt. Parker/Davis Path Trailhead, US-302 (Jericho Rd area)

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Resolution rises to 3400 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3400 feet, Mount Resolution is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Davis Path via Mt. Parker Trail**, a **8.4 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Stairs Mountain**, which is just 2.0 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.

trails.name: Davis Path via Mt. Parker Trail

logistics.parking_info: Mt. Parker/Davis Path Trailhead, US-302 (Jericho Rd area)
